Author: George Rawlings
Post Text: I'm NOT proud of this article. ğŸ¥´Why? Because we had to sell a chunk of the business to get it off the ground in 2020 when we weren't in a tech recession. Worth noting that raising was much easier back then. ğŸ’²If Thursday didn't need the cash then we wouldn't have taken the investment. ğŸ’°What I've learnt since this round of funding is that too many founders (myself included) need to stop glamourising fund raising. ğŸ˜Instead build something solid and focus on revenue early, like any normal business! Less than 1% of VC backed consumer tech companies get hyper growth anyway, where the only metric that matters is the number of users. ğŸ“ˆWhat my co-founder, Matthew, and I ARE proud of is having the pleasure of working with SeedLegals since the very beginning. It's an absolute minefield out there and we couldn't have done it without them. ğŸ™ğŸ»

Author: George Rawlings
Post Text: Yesterday's post did not portray the message I was trying to and I owe it to current and former Thursday employees to correct this.My intention was to be honest with you all and say that it has been a tough few months as a founder and I, as an individual, have really struggled with it.We have had to make some very hard decisions, including redundancies in London whilst we focus more on other cities. I now understand from reading the comments that yesterday's post was poorly written and didn't come across as I'd intended and I'm very sorry for that.There are some extraordinary talented individuals on the market, who I know would love to hear about any exciting opportunities. If you're looking for people in Events, Developers, Design or Data please get in touch and I'd love to connect you.Thank you for reading. I'll do better going forward.George
